channel.title: Comments on: Sharing large repositories with your team
channel.description: Plataformatec's place to talk about Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Elixir, and software engineering

item.title: By: Gustavo Dutra
item.dc:creator: Gustavo Dutra
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/12/sharing-large-repositories-with-your-team/comment-page-1/#comment-1355">Petteri Räty</a>.
Actually, Patteri, we have a flash drive available for that. So we can clone directly from the flash drive to someone's computer (there is a script that do all the dirty work inside this flash drive).
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Petteri Räty.

Actually, Patteri, we have a flash drive available for that. So we can clone directly from the flash drive to someone’s computer (there is a script that do all the dirty work inside this flash drive).

item.title: By: Petteri Räty
item.dc:creator: Petteri Räty
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/12/sharing-large-repositories-with-your-team/comment-page-1/#comment-1354">Gustavo Dutra</a>.
You still need to get the bundle copied from somewhere so you can't compare just the clone with a clone over the internet. If you keep a bundle around, (to avoid needing an other developer) in for example local network somewhere, you might as well have a clone there.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Gustavo Dutra.

You still need to get the bundle copied from somewhere so you can’t compare just the clone with a clone over the internet. If you keep a bundle around, (to avoid needing an other developer) in for example local network somewhere, you might as well have a clone there.

item.title: By: Gustavo Dutra
item.dc:creator: Gustavo Dutra
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/12/sharing-large-repositories-with-your-team/comment-page-1/#comment-1353">Petteri Räty</a>.
Hi, Petteri!
It is faster cloning from a developer machine over intranet then over internet. Although, as git bundle does not require internet connection, cloning from a bundle package is faster then cloning from another developer repository. Also, it does not require any developer to be around when setting up a new project environment.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Petteri Räty.

Hi, Petteri!

It is faster cloning from a developer machine over intranet then over internet. Although, as git bundle does not require internet connection, cloning from a bundle package is faster then cloning from another developer repository. Also, it does not require any developer to be around when setting up a new project environment.

item.title: By: Petteri Räty
item.dc:creator: Petteri Räty
item.description: For comparison how long does a local git clone take? If it's faster then the bundle packing / unpacking then you could just clone locally from another developer machine...
item.content:encoded: For comparison how long does a local git clone take? If it’s faster then the bundle packing / unpacking then you could just clone locally from another developer machine…
